page.title: 05Bellfield Farm,Markinch
page.content: Bellfield Farm is a big farm, Consisting mostly of cultivated fields,grasslands and rough grazing. The farm has a private water supply which holds 6000 gallons.The water is largely needed for the 120 fresian cattle which are kept on the farm.They drink about 6 gallons of water each day,but in return give 6 to 8 gallons of milk.In addition to the cattle mentioned there are 2 bulls on the farm and a horse called Pinker who was ten years old. There are 6 workers on the farm.Three of them are members of the family which owns the farm and three come from the outside.They live with their families in cottages near the farm.On Harbour Hill to the north of the farm some test boring for coal has taken place recently.
